comments:
3.3M4, observed on ppc

- likely to be timing-related
- shutting down eclipse I got the exception below once
- I think the trace implies that one of the tabs had an animated image on the go

org.eclipse.swt.SWTError: No more handles
        at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java(Compiled Code))
        at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java(Inlined Compiled Code))
        at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java(Compiled Code))
        at org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Image.getImageData(Image.java(Compiled Code))
        at org.eclipse.ui.internal.presentations.defaultpresentation.AnimatedTabItem$1.run(AnimatedTabItem.java(Compiled Code))
        at java.util.TimerThread.mainLoop(Timer.java:447)
        at java.util.TimerThread.run(Timer.java:397)

- logging with SWT for now while we look into how UI is doing their animation
Shutdown is tricky.  We need to review the approach that the animation is taking to ensure it plays well with Eclipse and SWT.
REopen if you see it again.
